title: BitcoinGirl.Club
author: BitcoinGirl.Club
content: Here it is https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5433315.0It does not allow me to quote but it allowed me to reply directly though.It exists, it's not deleted both are the same though, it's viewable to me too LOLAnyone else is having such unwanted error?

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Any chance you click hide on that's section (because the message contain no longer viewable by you)? I can quote it without any problem.Quote from: maraches on January 07, 2023, 12:16:37 AMHello.I'm trying to transfer some USDT that are on the TRC20 network and I get this "FAILED -TRANSACTION REVERT>" error.Has this happened to anyone?

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on January 07, 2023, 04:25:58 AMAny chance you click hide on that's section (because the message contain no longer viewable by you)? I can quote it without any problem.As you can see, I can see the topic clearly or how did I take the screen shot or even was able to reply the OP ðŸ¤£?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: You probably ignored the altcoin discussion board that's why it says " is no longer viewable by you." As i can quote the post after checking this thread but when i tried to ignored the board, i encounter the same message you posted.Although, i think the "is no longer viewable by you." should be changed because you can literally view the thread as you can access it.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on January 07, 2023, 04:35:43 AMQuote from: Despairo on January 07, 2023, 04:25:58 AMAny chance you click hide on that's section (because the message contain no longer viewable by you)? I can quote it without any problem.As you can see, I can see the topic clearly or how did I take the screen shot or even was able to reply the OP ðŸ¤£?I clearly understand what I'm talking about, you might see the topic from someone post/recent post, but you're not visit on Altcoins discussion section.If you want to fix it, just click your profile (with your ID number) and paste this ";sa=ignoreBoards"Uncheck the Altcoins discussion section, let's see what you will get.Anyway I've learn new thing, "hide" and "ignore" are different.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: January 07, 2023, 04:49:23 AMLast edit: January 07, 2023, 05:07:25 AM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: He can click on profile -> Ignore Boards Preferences, to uncheck it.Quote from: Despairo on January 07, 2023, 04:47:50 AMUncheck the Altcoins discussion section, let's see what you will get.It would work perfectly and he will be able to quote the user's post that he wants to quote. If a board is put on ignore, it will not appear again through the forum home page, but what I think that happened is that BitcoinGirl.Club opened the altcoin board already before in his browser, but later put the altcoin board on ignore. If done like that, he will still be able to access the altcoin board through the altcoin board link already opened in his browser, but forgetting that he put the board on ignore.I guess some people can leave a link opened on their browser for days, weeks...

comments.author: notocactus
comments.created_time: January 07, 2023, 05:04:06 AMLast edit: January 07, 2023, 05:17:08 AM by tranthidung
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on January 07, 2023, 04:35:43 AMAs you can see, I can see the topic clearly or how did I take the screen shot or even was able to reply the OP ðŸ¤£?Yes, it is a bug.There is a chance so slim to see this coincidence if OP opened the topic, and shortly later ignored that board. In this case, that topic will no longer be seen at the forum main page https://bitcointalk.org/index.php because a whole board will be hidden, including that topic. However, if OP has a browser page that opened that topic before the ignore button was used, OP can still read it. Then it can cause a problem when hitting Report button.OP can still open and view that topic if he has a link too.Another problem is you can not merit any post in that topic and that board.I confirm that I can still be able to edit my post after ignoring Meta board.Sum upIf you ignore a boardYou can open a topic and view posts inside if you have a topic linkYou can edit your posts in that topic, in that board too.Posts in that board will be hidden at your post history page.You can not reply, quote, and merit any post in that board. Reply, Quote and Merit buttons are available but you will get error.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: If you're certain you didn't ignore the board.the only other alternatives I can think of is that you have no script enabled or another plug in that's trying to improve your privacy by not sending something across when it's put in the url bar by the quote.It's been said before that you can't load up the site without noscript over tor and I don't know if that's the same if you use a vpn or not (if cloud flare or Google have built up a profile about you it might not be needed).

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on January 07, 2023, 04:40:34 AMYou probably ignored the altcoin discussion board that's why it says " is no longer viewable by you." This is the most plausible reason why OP cannot quote that reply.I just went through the motions of ignoring the altcoin discussion board and then using the link in this thread to access that post and try to quote it; I am hit with the exact same error message.On trying to create a reply, the message box opens, but I didn't try to send a post to know if I don't get an error message back as well.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on January 07, 2023, 04:24:42 AMAnyone else is having such unwanted error?I tried to quote the same post and it works for me like for any other post, but like other people said you probably have Altcoins board on ignore.Something similar happens to me only when I have many opened tabs for longer amount of time and then I get error that I can't quote or reply anything until I refresh the page.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Upgrade00 on January 07, 2023, 06:57:40 PMThis is the most plausible reason why OP cannot quote that reply.I just went through the motions of ignoring the altcoin discussion board and then using the link in this thread to access that post and try to quote it; I am hit with the exact same error message.On trying to create a reply, the message box opens, but I didn't try to send a post to know if I don't get an error message back as well.It shows the error only when you try to quote, but when you use reply then it works. I have many boards on ignore and after reading the responses I tried on another board results the same error.Thanks everyone for your responses and checking the error. It resolves the issue. New learning though. I will lock the topic.
